before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"65in3","text":"Have a checklist - (1) water jacket,  (2) stirrer, (3) lid as a reminder to do these steps each time","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"et8ok","text":"Thanks to a lovely combination of trial and error I present to you an optimized* protocol for using an oxygen electrode to create a light curve for Ostrecoccus tauri. The light curve can be used to determine what light intensity is ideal for photosynthesis in O. tauri, which can then inform the light conditions for a subsequent bicarbonate curve. An O. tauri bicarb curve could potentially indicate (when compared to other algal bicarb curves) whether or not this species has a carbon-concentrating mechanism.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":148,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":260,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":352,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q80h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhge9","text":"*This protocol could be further optimized by making a growth curve for O. tauri first. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ljmr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70gi1","text":"*The protocol is written for O. tauri and can be adapted to other algal species. When adapting it will be necessary to reassess optimal cell density for measurements, and consider the choice of buffer for washing and incubating cells. ASW is used in this situation but will not be suitable for fresh water species","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Oxygen electrode, light curve, Ostreococcus tauri, Hansatech, Oxygraph+,Photosynthesis

Oxygraph+ electrode control unit","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgeio","text":"DW1 - Oxygen electrode chamber","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctsso","text":"S1 - Spare O-rings set for DW1/AD","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2t6","text":"S6B Assorted Spare ‘O’ rings for DW2/2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ohdh","text":"S16 - Electrode cleaning kit","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88rch","text":"Rapid electrode disc polish","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nqeh","text":"USB2.0 A to B - Thin Blue)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfl3p","text":"Cotton buds (small enough to fit in the well of the (small, the kind you'd use for painting precise lines)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qp0g","text":"dH2O","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":2,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"codev","text":"Kimwipes ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2el00","text":"1 mL Pasteur status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cnfj6","text":"Prepare the electrolyte","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sh6f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aheut","text":"Pour the salt into a   glass bottle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a1abq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"FCCAC010F1A011EC9A8FFFFB9775DB84","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1u5l","text":"Measure   of dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":15,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f1kl5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"0019EB10F1A111EC9A8FFFFB9775DB84","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f7lrl","text":"Pour the water into the same bottle as salt","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7diak","text":"Close the lid and swirl the bottle with mild aggression until salt is dissolved","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vfrv","text":"Prepare 0.5 M NaHCO3 Solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":19,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d48qm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ana5a","text":"Dispense   of dH2O into a 50 mL centrifuge tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":16,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1grgo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"7E711960F1A211EC9A8FFFFB9775DB84","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ch343","text":"Add   of sodium bicarbonate to the dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":37,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2bb4o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.420","error":false,"guid":"79059E60126D11ED928FFDE7342E65F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"atblc","text":"Close lid and invert until everything is dissolved","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80jia","text":"Cut a slightly larger square of the provided PTFE membrane tape and place it on top of the paper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26fti","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"df560","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"157ut","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3slr3","text":"If the membrane tape is a little dusty, run it between your thumb and index fingers gently to try and wipe off any debris","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"79AA0210F26B11EC932D259257877E35","height":112,"id":277281,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7n4lv","text":"What electrode looks like after this step","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3dbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3bbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3cbudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3abudxf.webp","width":301}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"av3a8","text":"Cut a 1.5-2 cm2 piece of thin cigarette paper to the top of the electrode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":14,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cpv4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ksss","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f3qdj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c3hi7","text":"Recommended brand: Rizla T ultra fine","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f2m8q","text":"Add 3-5 drops of water so that the silver band inside the well is completely covered.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7dpge","text":"Use a disposable Pasteur pipette to add a drop of electrolyte to the top of the platinum electrode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bqb4q","text":"Use a clean, dH2O-dampened cotton bud to remove the residual polish. A kimwipe can be used to dry the electrode after this step, too.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":15,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6j14r","text":"Polish the platinum electrode as well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c5ek","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bjhob","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4acah","text":"Try not to polish the epoxy resin surrounding the electrode as it can alter the shape of the dome, thus affecting accuracy.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6vv7e","text":"Circle the inside of the well with the polish","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5panu","text":"Dampen a cotton bud with dH2O and use it to pick up a thin layer of Hansatech Rapid Electrode Disc Polish to clean the electrode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":27,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7eibs","text":"Start the water jacket going at 25 oC so it’s ready by the time your electrode is prepared","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":35,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"esbif","text":"Clean and Prepare the electrode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kbbm","text":"Use the membrane applicator to secure the small O-ring over the membrane and cigarette paper at the base of the electrode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tlq2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ldn4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C7861B40F26B11EC932D259257877E35","height":222,"id":277285,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1s9i7","text":"Membrane applicator with o-ring","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3hbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3fbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3gbudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3ebudxf.webp","width":269}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6k6ep","text":"Place the large O-ring in the indentation outside the well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64nb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ebusq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8b61s","text":"Make sure this is one of the thicker large o-rings, otherwise your sample will leak out of the electrode chamber and your curve will be less curvey and more zig-zaggy.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1iobf","text":"Tuck any extra edges of membrane into the well using forceps so it doesn't touch the larger O-ring","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46vd8","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9togh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FE32D750F26B11EC932D259257877E35","height":170,"id":277289,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a3tl8","text":"Fully set up electrode disc","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3mbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3jbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3kbudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3ibudxf.webp","width":237}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bgug1","text":"Attach the cord that connects the control unit to the electrode, then fit the disc into the bottom of the electrode chamber (pictures in steps 4.1-4.2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60h4d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bkb7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rn55","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm4cv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d8sau","text":"Open O2View program on laptop","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"btjil","text":"Add port cover blanks to 3 of the open ports and insert the red light to the 4th open port.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":78,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff1tk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmjtm","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eurqb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2974D8400DF711EDA460FD07F8424B8C","height":412,"id":277293,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IMG_8375OElec.jpeg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3rbudxf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3pbudxf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3qbudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3nbudxf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ekve","text":"Insert the light sensor to the top opening of the electrode chamber, ensuring the circular patch is facing the light source (pictures in steps 4.1-4.2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dc0p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u5b2","text":"Light Calibration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fir8f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"av510","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2q6q9","text":"Needed for light curve, and the light curve needs to be done before the bicarbonate curve","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26hkj","text":"Ensure both the light and light sensor are inserted to their appropriate ports, and that the light sensor is actually facing the light","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"k66j","text":" chamber before light sensor and electrode disc are in place","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3vbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3tbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3ubudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3sbudxf.webp","width":393}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D30CBD60F26C11EC932D259257877E35","height":269,"id":277301,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9oalu","text":"Electrode chamber.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3zbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3xbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3ybudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq3wbudxf.webp","width":359}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bm230","text":"In the O2View program, in the upper menu bar, click Calibrate \u003e calibrate light (automatic)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"av0ah","text":"This should take a few minutes but it will do it itself.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"6A3E2C5DF26D11ECA31A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.academia.edu/35915450/Oxygen_Solubility_Table_Salinity"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"75215AC0F26D11EC932D259257877E35","height":337,"id":277309,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq39budxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq37budxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq38budxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq36budxf.webp","width":329}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qpu8","text":"Enter stirrer speed of 75","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"di579","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4kr93","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"93752DD0F26D11EC932D259257877E35","height":286,"id":277313,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4dbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4bbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4cbudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4abudxf.webp","width":339}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"btbkj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8t9i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cb0pb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A3B88A20F26D11EC932D259257877E35","height":199,"id":277317,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4hbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4fbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4gbudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4ebudxf.webp","width":360}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A978B520F26D11EC932D259257877E35","height":117,"id":277321,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4mbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4jbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4kbudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4ibudxf.webp","width":398}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bk71n","text":"Don't click \"OK\" on prompt 4 of 5 until you have your zeroing chemical ready. Nitrogen gas was the preferred method of zeroing the oxygen due to its availability and lessened risk of affecting any subsequent measurements (unlike Sodium Dithionite, which can also be used). The nitrogen tank is intimidating and can take a few tries to get used to.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7hp2q","text":"Nitrogen gas was introduced to the chamber from a large tank at the end of the bench through a tube with a 1000 μL pipette tip attached. The pipette tip goes directly into the ASW in the electrode chamber, preferably without jamming it into the electrode disc. Leave it in until the signal has plateaued and the calibration is saved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br47j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2v80","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b35l1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CE2C4E90F26D11EC932D259257877E35","height":203,"id":277325,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4rbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4pbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4qbudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4nbudxf.webp","width":362}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8vpcr","text":"Preparing Light Curve Culture Samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gdk9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7b3k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"38on2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"comdh","text":"It's suggested to prepare each sample right before performing a light curve on it, rather than preparing them all together and having some sit out for longer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6i7m8","text":"In a flow hood, pour   of a healthy culture into a 50 mL centrifuge tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"35gqk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djk15","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8dahc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"49179790F26E11EC932D259257877E35","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8stif","text":"\"Healthy\" is entirely subjective but generally suggests a more vibrant yellow-green","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cgft","text":"Prepare a balance with another tube of   of dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":46,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ctpc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"72A0FC00F26E11EC932D259257877E35","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"11g08","text":"Centrifuge for  at   and 20oC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":27,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":15,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dm4vs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mpu1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68r5a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"0D8996300DF611ED86D9D9F70DD718DA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5000","error":false,"guid":"F869B8200DF511ED86D9D9F70DD718DA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3s65b","text":"Discard the supernatant by micropipetting","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6a3k1","text":"Resuspend in   of ASW by gently disturbing the pellet with a small paintbrush","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6v0q0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7485a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6025o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"7E4AD300F26E11EC932D259257877E35","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3ggqs","text":"Too large of a paintbrush will absorb all your cells and media. It can be done, but it is alarming. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7aorh","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"pr9f","text":"If you only have a large paintbrush and it does eat your cells, you can try adding another 1.5mL directly onto the brush to sort of wash the cells off. It might not look convincing, but it should allow you to have enough left for a test.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9b89t","text":"Balance with dH2O again in centrifuge for  ,  , 20 oC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":15,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":51,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":45,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9p1io","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"31B2F1000DF611ED86D9D9F70DD718DA","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5000","error":false,"guid":"36D703100DF611ED86D9D9F70DD718DA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7ckf","text":"Discard the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4h7fk","text":"Add   ASW to the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ci9ne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"ED778480F26E11EC932D259257877E35","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4bs9t","text":"Swirl the tube gently","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amdsi","text":"Use the paintbrush again to resuspend. Press the paintbrush against the inside of the tube when pulling it out to try and save as much of the sample as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e1hts","text":"Photon Flux Density Table Set up for Light Cruve","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cc1ls","text":"Remove ASW from chamber","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e13e3","text":"Make sure the stirrer is still going (can turn off while removing ASW)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7c057","text":"In the top menu bar, click Hardware \u003e New PFD table","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7sji5","text":"Select auto","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4udpm","text":"Adjust so the following intensities of light (umoles) are selected for 1 minute each: 0, 5, 20, 40, 80, 120, 200, 400, 800, 1600. Click save if you need to close the window, otherwise leave the window up until you clock \"go.\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es54v","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7e6m2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c10p0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ss8i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"98C2AEF0F26F11ECA79B4F11F85D5438","height":408.5769230769231,"id":277329,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f8o80","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4vbudxf.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4tbudxf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4ubudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4sbudxf.webp","width":535.6134453781511}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fijbu","text":"This screenshot is from before time was adjusted to 1 min. 2 mins tends to result in a flatline because it allows too much oxygen to build up in the chamber.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"biuem","text":"Add   of culture","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"64grg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"900","error":false,"guid":"C03875A0F26F11ECA79B4F11F85D5438","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9lub7","text":"Add   of NaHCO3 solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":14,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"csovo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"C4579AD0F26F11ECA79B4F11F85D5438","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3biin","text":"Place the plunger into the chamber","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9diqf","text":"Click \"Go\" on PFD window","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b15n1","text":"When program is done, turn off stirrer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PFD Table Set up for Light Curve
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4m29f","text":"View QY Data tab and save the file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61ca2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsliq","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aaf9l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"64scf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkehm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1D35F8C00DED11ED89853DB105F5299F","height":332,"id":277333,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"6-30-22-LightCurve-TestO-Capture.PNG","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4zbudxf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4xbudxf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4ybudxf.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iq4wbudxf.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":8,"offset":71,"style":"italic"}],"key":"8dtsc","text":"Graph pictured above shows 400-800umols of light as being the best for O. tauri photosynthesis.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"enbth","text":"Clean Up","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"41gpm","text":"Make sure everything is turned off (stirrer, light)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6tu9r","text":"Take out and put away the optical port blanks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"766cf","text":"Take out the light","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6mp7f","text":"Unscrew the bottom of the electrode chamber, careful not to let the electrode and magnetic follower fall","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4ph0v","text":"Pull out the electrode disk, catch the magnetic follower","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42nb4","text":"Rinse the inside of the electrode chamber with dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":49,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9pna","text":"Take the O-rings off the electrode and rinse them with dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":57,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8f66l","text":"Take off the membrane and paper from the electrode and dispose of them in the bio-waste bin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dms8r","text":"Rinse the electrode disc with dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":32,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5i6hs","text":"Rinse the magnetic flea with dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":31,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"egptr","text":"Make sure everything is gently and thoroughly dried, use a kimwipe for the electrode disc. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"as310","text":"Repeat the same polish process as done at the beginning on the electrode/electrode disc. It's important to clean the electrode disc thoroughly right after you're done using it to prevent any tarnish buildup, which can happen after one day of use. The electrode disc should also be stored with a dehydration packet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1dl7v","text":"Weigh out   of sodium bicarbonate ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.420","error":false,"guid":"57D120500DDD11ED89853DB105F5299F","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kdd","text":"Weigh out   of anhydrous KCl salt","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"17.5","error":false,"guid":"BF6AB12D0DDD11EDB9BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"onf","text":"Remove the sample from the electrode chamber using a pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
